Ubuntu synchronizes automatically with a timeserver when the defaultroute network interface goes up. That's the default setup

it's for time synchronization all right. The package that syncs your host with an internet timeserver, though, is ntpdate. And its default setup is fine. You're not supposed to install ntpd unless you know exactly what you are doing
